{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3489040,"name":"Lucas Fontes Francisco","username":"temaosmetais","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/temaosmetais/{size}/209698_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T17:53:20.193Z","cooked":"

Hello! We’re experiencing this issue with the Classic NavX MXP. We’ve received warnings in the Driver Station that the NavX is connecting and disconnecting suddenly.

We’ve updated our NavX to the latest version. It didn’t solve our issue. We’re sure the electrical connection between the NavX and the roboRIO is stable.

We’re using YAGSL, here’s our repository

Here’s some of our DS Logs that show those messages

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T17:54:14.718Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":70,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":374.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482899,"topic_slug":"classic-navx-mxp-is-connecting-and-disconnecting-suddenly","display_username":"Lucas Fontes Francisco","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Y_lcpqJYZx0C_I5IhiMlIXbEieEgeNkM?usp=sharing","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"DS Log - Google Drive","clicks":3},{"url":"https://github.com/pedrohenriquelacerda/YAGSL-PHOTONVISION.git","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - pedrohenriquelacerda/YAGSL-PHOTONVISION","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62991,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"temaosmetais"},"post_url":"/t/classic-navx-mxp-is-connecting-and-disconnecting-suddenly/482899/1","custom_user_title":"temaosmetais","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3489052,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T18:08:17.908Z","cooked":"

You should power your NavX over USB as well as the MXP. This normally prevents these kind of failures

DiscoBots found an issue with the NavX and calibration. It might be a related issue. NavX2-MXP always Calibrating

We solved it! (kinda of)
We tried connecting the NavX via USB and changing the IMU type in the swervedrive.json from " navx_spi" to “navx_usb”. We stopped receiving the messages in the Driver Station and we confirmed the NavX was working after checking the IMU values in the Shuffleboard.

8513 and 3142 were practicing together yesterday and both had random navX disconnect/reconnects when using"navx_spi". We are both powering the navX with usb and mxp, and we are both running yagsl. We both switched to “navx_usb” and the issues went away. We also tried swapping to our navx from last year which never had any issues and we still saw the disconnect over spi.

We left a benchtop rio not running yagsl, just posting the navx (over spi) yaw to NT for 3 hours, and saw no disconnects.

@nstrike any chance there is a something going on between yagsl and navX?

Not that i am aware of. Were you using 2025.7.2-beta2? I was messing around with it in the release and changed the way inversions work in 2025.7.2-beta3

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T16:12:12.362Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":45,"readers_count":44,"score":29.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482899,"topic_slug":"classic-navx-mxp-is-connecting-and-disconnecting-suddenly","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/classic-navx-mxp-is-connecting-and-disconnecting-suddenly/482899/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3550424,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T16:23:06.684Z","cooked":"

I dug into this issue this morning and it boils down to this.

“YAGSL poses are blue-origin. The SwerveDrive.zeroGyro function resets the gyro offset to the current reading and rsets the odometry to the current pose with the heading as 0 (facing to the red alliance). On startup SmartDashboard/swerve/imu/adjusted should be relative to this. So if you are on the red alliance facing the blue alliance your gyro reading should be 180deg. The odometry heading is impacted by the module reporting. So if your module is reporting that a wheel is driving CCW- it will undo changes to the odometry heading given by the gyro. Likewise if the module locations are incorrect, or the gyro needs inverted. These permutations are tested with the 8 steps.

PathPlanner will reset the odometry to the starting pose in the path if it is configured to. Therefore if you do not reset your pose with PathPlanner after zeroing the gyro or PathPlanner doesn’t flip the rotation then your starting pose could be incorrect, facing backwards.

Ontop of all this the SwerveInputStream.allianceRelativeControl checks the alliance you are on and if it is red and you enabled alliance relative control your ChassisSpeeds Translation2d will be flipped 180 to compensate.

YAGSL no longer has changing alliance origin this year which is why this issue is getting discovered and difficult to debug.”

I hope this helps!

That is definitely helpful, but doesn’t explain the

“NavX Disconnected”
“NavX Reconnected”

In our DS logs. While its disconnected our robot thinks its always facing 0 degrees which causes issues when driving at all.
